creator: bbonacci

content:
Bazı e-postalar ulaşmıyorsa Thunderbird'de değil de e-posta sunucunuzda sorun var demektir. Bu durumda muhtemelen MEB'e danışmanız gerekir. Ancak e-postaların size ulaştıktan sonra siliniyor olma ihtimali de var.

Cihazlardan biri indirilen e-postaları sunucudan silmeye ayarlanmış olabilir. Menü > Hesap ayarları > Eşitleme ve depolama sayfasına girip "Hiçbir iletiyi silme" seçeneğinin seçili olduğunu kontrol edin. Bu kontrolü tüm cihazlarda yapmalısınız.

Ayrıca, e-postaları almak için IMAP kullanıyorsanız (Menü > Hesap ayarları > Sunucu ayarları sayfasında "Sunucu türü: IMAP posta sunucusu" yazar.) bir kişi bir e-postayı kendi bilgisayarından sildiği zaman o e-posta tüm bilgisayarlardan silinir.

content: One way to find out: - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' - you will now be in the profile. If the account was POP, then look in the Mail folder, otherwise, look in the Imapmail folder

creator: jvwhyte

content:
jvwhyte said
I came across this message from March 2022 - "I read at AskLeo that I could use Thunderbird with Gmail as a way to backup my Gmail emails to my computer. I then want to backup the Thunderbird folder using a backup program to save the emails to an external drive.

Why will folk not just use the Google takeout service? Relatively quick, very comprehensive and you end up with a fairly standard MBOX file that google compress for you that you can store as a backup.

Thunderbird can natively read mbox files, but so can many other mail clients, if you ever need to access the backup. So why involve Thunderbird in a Gmail backup at all? I just fail to understand that when Gmail offers good, simple, robust and fit for purpose tools.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Thanks for your comments Matt.

I have used Google Takeout to an extent in the past but have been put off by the sheer size of the files created - for example, a mail folder of 120 emails, when downloaded gave me an mbox file of 165Mb (127 when compressed), nor did I find it a particularly speedy process.

I don't really understand the sizing & structures. My All Mail folder in gmail has > 26,000 mails going back several years, but organised by topic (folder/label) rather than by date. The Google One storage page indicates that gmail is taking just 1.68Gb of my Drive.

I probably retain far too many emails but I do like being able to access all my records and search mails without having to "access" a backup.

I am also coming to the view that I should perhaps pay for private and secure email and move away from free services like Gmail that monetize my personal data. Google is not an organisation I feel very good about.

https://www.theverge.com/2019/11/26/20977968/google-graveyard-products-shut-down-dead-not-supported-discontinues-spring-cleaning

A combination of, for example, Proton Mail or Fastmail with a desktop client like Thunderbird, would allow me a bit more freedom to take a considered approach so I'm testing a few options to see where it takes me.
creator: jvwhyte

content: Hi Shubham, Just to be sure. You are not using Proton mail, you are using your existing email with the proton VPN? If yes, is it just the sending that doesn't work? content:
You might find it is an antivirus problem, or a VPN problem.

Antivirus and their self signed certificates in connections can cause issues, but in th9is instance I would be looking to a VPN if you have one as they offer a fake location on the internet. All very good if you want to watch geo blocked content. Particularly unhelpful when you are connecting to web sites that know where you live and work and have been tracking your general movements through travel for as long as you have had an account with them. They go, you suddenly turned up in Budapest today, you never went there before, we will stick up a password check to ensure it is not the oauth hijackers.

The ones in December are discussed here https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/security/blog/2022/11/16/token-tactics-how-to-prevent-detect-and-respond-to-cloud-token-theft/ but token hijacking may be the "new" security issue for 2024.
creator: MattAuSupport
